intro: Capillipedium longisetosum, commonly known as the long-hairy capillipedium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its intricate and showy floral structures. The plant features slender stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its unique appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with vibrant colors that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Capillipedium longisetosum is considered a species of conservation concern.
